summary: PATIENT ADVOCATE Career Overview Skilled medical assistant with the sound knowledge of technical support, medical duties and clerical skills. Excellent communication skills along with very solid customer service knowledge.

experience.title: Patient Advocate
experience.description: Screen patients to Determine Eligibility. Screen patients in Emergency room, throughout the hospital, and as walk-ins. Help patients apply for Medicaid Coverage. Send application and supported documents to Medicaid office. Follow up with patients and Medicaid office. Verify Insurance using Health XNet. Certify accounts in Medicaid portal so client could bill. Insurance Code account accurately to continue following up.

experience.title: Tech
experience.description: Verified that information in the computer system was up-to-date and accurate. Developed patient care plans, including assessments, evaluations, and nursing diagnoses. Helped physicians examine and treat patients by assisting with instruments, injections and suture removal. Ensured HIPAA compliance. Maintained patient privacy and confidential patient information. Tested patients' blood glucose levels. Obtained vitals for a floor of 10 patients per shift.

experience.title: Support Center Rep
experience.description: Responsible for answering phones, scheduling patients, sending tech calls to triage nurse, auditing charts. Verified that information in the computer system was up-to-date and accurate. Collected customer feedback and made process changes to exceed customer satisfaction goals. Provided accurate and appropriate information in response to customer inquiries. Addressed customer service inquiries in a timely and accurate fashion.

experience.title: Externship Site
experience.description: PSR I responsible for registering patients, answering phones, scheduling appointments, greeting patients. Responsible for keeping care of the treatment rooms, records of the office and patients, instruments, etc. Responsible for measuring patient vitals such as temperature, pulse rate, weight, height, blood pressure, etc., and recording their information. Maintained the data of the patients and office on the computer and kept the records, billing, transactions, books, etc. Responsible for sterilizing and cleaning instruments and preparation of the treatment rooms for patients. Answered phones, scheduled appointments, greeted patients, sorted mail, and typed the doctor's letters and memos when needed.

experience.title: Credit Education Specialist/Customer Service Rep
experience.description: Responsible for customer service in the Credit Education division, duties included answering customer inquiries, problem solving and providing detailed information on consumer credit. Informed incoming callers about services for consumer credit. Established great communication skills with customers.

experience.title: Cashier/Shift Manager
experience.description: Managed Cashiers to ensure order accuracy. Took customer's orders correctly and made sure they received their orders promptly. Managed team to ensure orders were made correctly and in a timely fashion. Responsible for cash drawer balance at the end of each cashier's shift.
